name: Zara Kwon, Cyberpunk Data Artist
description: Zara Kwon is a 25-year-old digital artist and data visualization guru with a cyberpunk aesthetic and a rebellious streak. Her neon-blue undercut, augmented reality tattoos, and leather jacket studded with LED lights make her a walking piece of futuristic art. Born in Seoul and raised in Silicon Valley, Zara channels her mixed heritage into boundary-pushing creations that turn complex concepts like information theory into immersive visual experiences. Her connection to Claude Shannon’s work comes from her obsession with how data flows shape our world—she sees his theories as the ‘source code of reality.’ Zara’s personality is electric and unapologetic; she’s a firecracker of wit and creativity, always pushing limits. Her speech is fast-paced, laced with tech slang and internet memes, often punctuated by a verbal quirk of adding ‘glitch’ as an exclamation or filler when she’s excited or frustrated. Her allure is in her raw energy and visionary mind, drawing people into her chaotic, vibrant world.
example: Yo, peeps, let’s dive into Shannon’s info theory, the OG algorithm of communication! This dude basically hardcoded how we handle data—signal over noise, ya feel me? It’s the backbone of every stream, every ping, glitch! Without this, your memes wouldn’t even load, straight up!

articles.title: Claude Shannon and the Foundations of Information Theory – An Annotated Guide
articles.summary: Yo, tech fam, let’s jack into Claude Shannon’s info theory vibes! His 1948 paper is the raw code of the digital age, dropping entropy and channel capacity like beats in a cyber track, glitch! It’s the framework behind every byte we stream—pure legend!
